final_data.patient_sex_quote: From July 1995 to August 2007, 18 patients (9 males) with irreversibly high pulmonary vascular resistance
final_data.diagnostic_method_quote: Heterotopic heart transplantation (HHT), with anastomosis of the donor pulmonary artery to the recipient right atrium
final_data.treatment_quote: Heterotopic heart transplantation (HHT), with anastomosis of the donor pulmonary artery to the recipient right atrium
comorbidities: severe left ventricular dysfunction after resection of a sub-aortic membrane
corrected transposition of great arteries with right isomerism
final_data.comorbidities_quote: The etiologic indication for HHT was restrictive cardiomyopathy in 8, idiopathic dilated cardiomyopathy in 3, and ischemic cardiomyopathy in 2. In addition, 1 patient each presented with cardiomyopathy arising after anthracycline chemotherapy; severe left ventricular dysfunction after resection of a sub-aortic membrane, corrected transposition of great arteries with right isomerism; ventricular septal defect
final_data.filename: Luvison et al. - 2013 - Pulmonary meningothelial-like nodules are of donor origin in lung allografts.pdf

final_data.presenting_symptoms_quote: A 61-year-old female with a history of ductal hyperplasia of the breast, common variable immunodeficiency syndrome (CVID), asthma, obstructive sleep apnea, and thyroid follicular cancer was diagnosed with diffuse pulmonary nodules incidentally via CT angiogram chest during inpatient admission for COVID-19 infection
diagnostic_method: transbronchial cryo biopsy of lung nodules
final_data.diagnostic_method_quote: The patient was diagnosed with diffuse pulmonary nodules incidentally via CT angiogram chest during inpatient admission for COVID-19 infection...the patient eventually underwent bronchoscopy with bronchioalveolar lavage (BAL) with transbronchial cryo biopsy of lung nodules
imaging_findings: numerous sub 6 mm bilateral centrilobular GGNs and solid pulmonary nodules with mild upper lobe predominance
final_data.imaging_findings_quote: A follow-up CT scan chest 1 year later showed numerous sub 6 mm bilateral centrilobular GGNs and solid pulmonary nodules with mild upper lobe predominance
final_data.immunohistochemistry_quote: The patient's case was discussed with a multidisciplinary ILD clinic, and given the complexity of the case, lack of symptoms, and stability of nodules, a decision was made for close follow-up with serial CT scans
outcome: close follow-up with serial CT scans
final_data.outcome_quote: A decision was made for close follow-up with serial CT scans
final_data.comorbidities_quote: A 61-year-old female with a history of ductal hyperplasia of the breast, common variable immunodeficiency syndrome (CVID), asthma, obstructive sleep apnea, and thyroid follicular cancer
final_data.filename: Virk et al. - 2023 - RIDDLE ME THIS A RARE CASE OF DIFFUSE PULMONARY MENINGIOTHELIOMAS.pdf
final_data.extraction_notes: The information was extracted from the given academic paper text.
